00020 /****************************************************************************
00021  * Public function implementations
00022  ****************************************************************************/
00023 int
00024 arrow_options_parse(int num_opts, arrow_option options[], char *description, 
00025                     char *usage, int argc, char *argv[], int *opt_ind)
00026 {
00027     int i, ret, idx = 0;
00028 
00029     char *short_options;
00030     struct option *long_options;
00031     int *given;
00032     
00033     if(argc == 1)
00034     {
00035         print_usage(argv[0], usage);
00036         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00037     }
00038     
00039     /* Allocate memory to required structures */
00040     if((short_options = malloc((num_opts * 2 + 2) * sizeof(char))) == NULL)
00041     {
00042         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for short_options");
00043         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00044     }
00045     if((long_options = malloc((num_opts + 2) * sizeof(struct option))) == NULL)
00046     {
00047         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for long_options");
00048         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00049     }
00050     if((given = malloc(num_opts * sizeof(int))) == NULL)
00051     {
00052         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for given");
00053         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00054     }
00055     
00056     /* Setup structures */
00057     for(i = 0; i < num_opts; i++)
00058     {
00059         if((options[i].short_option == 'h') ||
00060            (options[i].short_option == 'V'))
00061         {
00062             arrow_print_error("h/V option specified.\n");
00063             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00064         }
00065         
00066         short_options[idx++] = options[i].short_option;
00067         long_options[i].name = options[i].long_option;
00068         long_options[i].flag = 0;
00069         long_options[i].val = options[i].short_option;
00070         
00071         if(options[i].arg_required)
00072         {
00073             short_options[idx++] = ':';
00074             long_options[i].has_arg = required_argument;
00075         }
00076         else
00077         {
00078             if(options[i].data_type != ARROW_OPTION_INT)
00079             {
00080                 arrow_print_error("Options with no argument must be ints");
00081                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00082                 goto CLEANUP;
00083             }
00084             long_options[i].has_arg = no_argument;
00085         }
00086         
00087         given[i] = ARROW_FALSE;
00088     }
00089     short_options[idx++] = 'h';
00090     long_options[num_opts].name = "help";
00091     long_options[num_opts].flag = 0;
00092     long_options[num_opts].val = 'h';
00093         
00094     short_options[idx++] = 'V';
00095     long_options[num_opts + 1].name = "version";
00096     long_options[num_opts + 1].flag = 0;
00097     long_options[num_opts + 1].val = 'V';
00098     
00099     short_options[idx++] = '\0';
00100     
00101     /* Process options with getopt_long */
00102     int opt; int opt_idx = 0; int found = ARROW_FALSE;
00103     while(1)
00104     {
00105         opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00106         if(opt == -1) break;
00107             
00108         if(opt == 'h')
00109         {
00110             print_usage(argv[0], usage);
00111             print_help(num_opts, options, description);
00112             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00113             goto CLEANUP;
00114         }
00115         else if(opt == 'V')
00116         {
00117             print_version(argv[0]);
00118             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00119             goto CLEANUP;
00120         }
00121         
00122         for(i = 0; i < num_opts; i++)
00123         {
00124             if(options[i].short_option == opt)
00125             {
00126                 if(options[i].arg_required)
00127                 {
00128                     switch(options[i].data_type)
00129                     {
00130                         case ARROW_OPTION_INT:
00131                             *((int *)(options[i].data_ptr)) = atoi(optarg);
00132                             break;
00133                         case ARROW_OPTION_DOUBLE:
00134                             *((double *)(options[i].data_ptr)) = atof(optarg);
00135                             break;
00136                         case ARROW_OPTION_STRING:
00137                             *((char **)(options[i].data_ptr)) = optarg;
00138                             break;
00139                         default:
00140                             arrow_print_error("Unknown data type");
00141                             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00142                             goto CLEANUP;
00143                     }   
00144                 }
00145                 else
00146                 {
00147                     *((int *)options[i].data_ptr) = ARROW_TRUE;
00148                 }
00149                 given[i] = ARROW_TRUE;
00150             }
00151             found = ARROW_TRUE;
00152         }
00153         
00154         if(!found)
00155         {
00156             fprintf(stderr, "Unknown argument: '%c'\n", opt);
00157             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00158             goto CLEANUP;
00159         }
00160     }
00161     
00162     /* Check for required arguments */
00163     for(i = 0; i < num_opts; i++)
00164     {
00165         if(options[i].opt_required && !given[i])
00166         {
00167             fprintf(stderr, "Missing argument: '-%c'/'--%s'\n", 
00168                     options[i].short_option, options[i].long_option);
00169             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00170             goto CLEANUP;    
00171         }
00172     }
00173     
00174     if(opt_ind != NULL)
00175         *opt_ind = optind;
00176     
00177     ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00178 CLEANUP:    
00179     free(short_options);
00180     free(long_options);
00181     free(given);
00182     
00183     return ret;
00184 }
00185 
00186 void
00187 print_usage(char *program_name, char *usage)
00188 {
00189     printf("Usage: %s %s\n", program_name, usage);
00190 }
00191 
00192 void
00193 print_version(char *program_name)
00194 {
00195     printf("%s (Arrow %s)\n", program_name, ARROW_VERSION);
00196     printf("(c) Copyright 2006-2008\n");
00197     printf("    John LaRusic, Eric Aubanel, and Abraham Punnen.\n");
00198     printf("\n");
00199     printf("This is free software.  You may redistribute copies of it\n");
00200     printf("under the terms of the GNU General Public License \n");
00201     printf("    <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>.\n");
00202     printf("There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n");
00203     printf("\n");
00204     printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00205 }
00206 
00207 void
00208 print_help(int num_opts, arrow_option options[], char *description)
00209 {
00210     int i;
00211     char *format;
00212     printf("%s\n", description);
00213     printf("\n");
00214     printf("Options:\n");
00215     for(i = 0; i < num_opts; i++)
00216     {
00217         if(options[i].arg_required)
00218             format = "  -%c [arg], --%s=[arg]:\n\t%s\n";
00219         else
00220             format = "  -%c, --%s:\n\t%s\n";
00221         printf(format, options[i].short_option, options[i].long_option,
00222                options[i].help_message);
00223     }
00224     printf("\n");
00225     printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00226 }
